pullRequest.body:
Add some results about transforming summable sequences `f n`  indexed by natural numbers , into multipliable sequeces of the form `1 + f n` using complex and real logs. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body: messageFile.md

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16543~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Sorry it's taken me a very long time to get around to reviewing this.
Sorry it's taken me a very long time to get around to reviewing this.
Apologies for the multiple rounds here - it looks like some of the existing lemmas in this file are formulated in some non-standard ways

```suggestion
    (fun x => ∑' n, f n x) atTop s :=
  fun v hv ↦ tendsto_finset_range.eventually <|
    tendstoUniformlyOn_tsum_of_cofinite_eventually hu (Nat.cofinite_eq_atTop ▸ hfu) v hv
```

Using the complex result above, while a small amount of work, is much easier.
```suggestion
    Summable (fun n : ℕ => log (1 + |f n|)) := by
  have : Summable (fun n ↦ Complex.ofRealCLM (log (1 + |f n|))) := by
    convert Complex.log_of_summable (Complex.ofRealCLM.summable hf.norm) with x
    rw [ofRealCLM_apply, ofReal_log (by positivity)]
    simp
  convert Complex.reCLM.summable this
```
I didnt know about this ofReallCLM, thats much nicer, thanks!

You seem to be against using existing results, but I'm not sure why.
```
  refine Complex.summable_cexp_multipliable (fun n _ => 1 + f n) (by simpa) ?_ ()
  simpa using Complex.log_of_summable hf
```
Sorry this was just an oversight, I added the `summable_cexp_multipliable` later on and then forgot to come back and update the proofs here!

Likewise, but note that `Real.summable_cexp_multipliable` is misnamed (it should be `rexp`, or better yet, both this and the `Complex` version shouldn't mention `exp` *at all*). Can you address the naming of those while you're at it, or open another PR to do so?
```
  refine Real.summable_cexp_multipliable (fun n _ => 1 + |f n|) (fun _ _ ↦ by positivity) ?_ ()
  simpa using Real.log_of_summable hf
```
Why not weaken this to `∀ᶠ n in atTop, ∀ x ∈ K, ‖f n x‖ ≤ u n`? I didn't think much, so maybe this isn't provable, but at a glance I think it should be.
Yeah that works, thanks!
Let's keep the space in line 282 (similarly 299)

The statement here looks strange to me - why is the `α` argument relevant? It looks like we're essentially working with a sequence of functions indexed by `ι` and `α`, but only ever summing / multiplying over the `ι` family.
good point, thanks!

```suggestion
    TendstoUniformlyOn (fun (n : ℕ) (a : α) => ∑ i in Finset.range n,
```

```suggestion
    (hfu : ∀ᶠ n in atTop, ∀ x ∈ s, ‖f n x‖ ≤ u n) :
```

```suggestion
    TendstoUniformlyOn (fun N x => ∑ n ∈ Finset.range N, f n x)
```

```suggestion
    HasProd f (∏' n : ι, f n) := by
```

```suggestion
lemma Real.hasProd_of_hasSum_log (f : ι → ℝ) (hfn : ∀ n, 0 < f n)
```
I think this is closer to what the naming convention would suggest

The shape of this hypothesis looks a little weird to me, isn't it just saying that this is summable? That is, it currently says "it has sum given by its tsum", which should be the same thing as just saying "it is summable". And similarly for the output type
I'd go with `Real.multipliable_of_summable_log`

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis): relate summable and multipliable sequences using log
